title: Kidnapped
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: All night, then, we walked through the north side of the Carse underthe high line of the Ochil mountains; and by Alloa and Clackmannan andCulross, all of which we avoided: and about ten in the morning, mightyhungry and tired, came to the little clachan of Limekilns.

title: Rob Roy - Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: They continued to take and give offence with as little hesitation asbefore the legislative dispersion which had been attempted, as appearsfrom the preamble to statute 1633, chapter 30, setting forth, that theclan Gregor, which had been suppressed and reduced to quietness by thegreat care of the late King James of eternal memory, had neverthelessbroken out again, in the counties of Perth, Stirling, Clackmannan,Monteith, Lennox, Angus, and Mearns; for which reason the statutere-establishes the disabilities attached to the clan, and, grants a newcommission for enforcing the laws against that wicked and rebelliousrace.

title: [Works]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: In about an hour he came aboard again, with a purse of money and the assurance that a good horse should be standing saddled for me by two to-morrow at Clackmannan  Pool.

title: [Works]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: All night, then, we walked through the north side of the Carse under the high line of the Ochil mountains ; and by Alloa and Clackmannan and Culross, all of which we avoided ; and about ten in the morning, mighty hungry and tired, came to the little clachan of Limekilns.

title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: But it would cost my cancelling half a volume, and rather than do so, I would, like the valiant Baron of Clackmannan,  kill the whole characters, the author, and the printer.

title: Reminiscences
author: Carlyle, Thomas
snippet: Our march to Stirling was under pouring rain for most part, but I recollect enjoying the romance of it; Kincardine, Culross (Cu'ros), Clackmannan, here they are then ; what a wonder to be here ! The Links of Forth, the Ochills, Grampians, Forth itself, Stirling, lion - shaped, ahead, like a lion couchant with the castle for his crown ; all this was beautiful in spite of rain.

title: The complete poetical and prose works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Katherine Bruce, daughter of Mr. Bruce of Newton, and widow of Henry Bruce of Clackmannan, died November 4, 1791, at the age of ninety-five.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Accompanied by this charming dame, he visited an old lady, Mrs. Bruce, of Clackmannan, who, in the belief that she had the blood of the royal Bruce in her veins, received the poet with something  of princely state, and, half in jest, conferred the honour of knighthood upon him, with her ancestor's sword, saying, in true Jacobitical mood, that she had a better right to do that than some folk had ! In the same pleasing company he visited the famous cataract on the Devon, called the Cauldron Linn, and the Rumbling bridge, a single arch thrown, it is said by the devil, over the Devon, at the height of a hundred feet in the air.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns:
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: From the Forth he went to the Devon, in the county of Clackmannan, where, for the first time, he saw the beautiful Charlotte Hamilton, the sister of his friend Gavin Hamilton, of Mauchline.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: ing extensive estates in Lothian, and in the shiresof Perth, Aberdeen, Caithness, Stirling, Ayr, Dumfries, and Galloway, besides minor establishmentsin Clackmannan, Renfrew, Lanark, and Berwickshires.

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: Two miles from the town on the summit of a windy hillstands the square grim mass of old masonry7 called Clackmannan Tower.

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: I left in the evening for Alloa, a town on the River Forth,in the small County of Clackmannan, and put up at theVictoria Hotel, a very orderly and nicely-kept place.
